title: Can Heimer get some love?
body: I haven't seen a Heimer in so long and whenever I do ser a Heimer, it ends up being a 4v5. Heimer suffers in this meta and suffers from many champions that counter and scale way better. Like honestly, take champions like Zyra and Azir and think to yourself "Why would I pick Heimer over these two?". Heimer does no damage to tanks. Turrets are easily taken out, even when you spread them out. His cooldowns are long and if you miss them, you are just a cannon minion. His passive is so useless mid-late game and seems randomly placed on Heimer. Immobile and easy to gank with a smart jungler that carries a smite for his turret. Hell, Heisondong, who is a Heimer main that was challenger/masters, hates playing Heimer in the past 2 seasons because people have been countering him so hard and knowing how to play against Heimers. Why this champ did not receive changes for the low scopes in the mage update confuses me.

2) Counters melee?  You mean, similarly to every other mage?

3) No skill? Well, he's actually one of the most difficult champions in all of league of legends. 

I think people need to learn what they are talking about before spewing it all over.

About the skill part, it depends on how much raw power the champion has. There are champions that have easy kits, but they are difficult to play perfectly (Master Yi, Annie, Akali, Evelynn). What defines most of these kits is raw power. If their raw power gets changed directly or indirectly, they can easily become overbearing or too weak.

While I want to agree with you that he is very difficult, he actually isn't. It's just his raw power got much weaker by the itemisation changes (Hexdrinker, Spirit Visage, Locket as a must in every game etc), some meta picks just counter or ignore him. He is also very risky to play, with no real reward if his enemies know how to play against him. 

He seems a high skill champion because he is weak. He has a difficult time winning against experienced players, and even when he snowballs, he either stomps extremely hard that any other champion could do his job better or he will just get outscaled as the game goes on.

Turrets have  150/175/200/225/250/275/300/325/350/375/400/425/450/475/500/525/550 base health.
The AP ratio for turret health ranges between 5% and 40%, based on level.
Their armor is 10-80, based on level.
Their magic resist is 25-65, based on level.

It takes Heimerdinger until level 7 to get turrets that are more durable than a **wave one caster minion**, and their health does not exceed that of **the first cannon minion** unless Heimer has a lot of both gold and XP.

I think his turrets are inherently gimped. When he's strong, you can't walk within 450 of him without taking extremely cheap and easy damage, and he pushes lanes harder than a Ziggs in urf. When he's strong, he's extremely safe: junglers don't want anywhere near him, and he can out-poke ranged and outright abuse melee champs.
When he's weak, he's dreadfully so, with little damage and little mobility.

He needs to have his turrets extremely nerfed. Perhaps make them last for only a short time, with increased range and damage. Or replace the ability all together.

Also, his Passive is probably the single worst ability in League. It's just so bad.

There are two things a Heimer does that puts him behind early if you counter it. First, you rush to your lane and see if heimer is putting down his turrets. Kill them off so that he has no pushing power. If heimer is not placing turrets in lane, then he is placing them on jungle camps for early level 2. If Heimer is top, you snipe out his turrets at gromp or krugs. If it's mid heim, then kill it at raptors. This puts him behind from what he is suppose to do and renders him useless. It is true that a few melees suffer against him but aside from that, about 90% of the cast destroys him.

Heimerdinger's main weakness is that unlike every other champion in the game, he doesn't have a passive that helps him at all.

All it does is grant **other champions** and turrets 10-30 HP5 (2-6 health restored per second).

Heimer himself doesn't get anything from it, so it just serves as a reminder of his base stats.

It's like if Caitlyn's passive was that she had 650 range, instead of her headshots.

Maybe he had something that actually let him protect his turrets, you would be able to pick him without banking on the enemy being bad.

Wouldn't it feel better if Heimer's passive were something that identified him with his turrets or, alternatively, as having many gizmos (his skills get empowered on a rotation or something I dunno)? As anything but an HP5 aura passive?

Honestly, if he and Leona changed passives, they'd feel more conducive to the champion (after appropriate balance ofc).
